Command google returned: ["https://www.bostonreview.net/articles/peter-godfrey-smith-being-octopus/", "https://www.bbc.com/future/article/20220720-do-octopuses-feel-pain", "https://www.supersummary.com/the-benefits-of-being-an-octopus/summary/", "https://www.goodreads.com/en/book/show/35890044", "https://www.frontiersin.org/articles/10.3389/fnsys.2022.840022/full", "https://www.curiouscitydpw.com/curiouscitydpw/wp/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/Benefits-Being-Octopus-Ed-Guide.pdf", "https://www.lynchburg.edu/wp-content/uploads/the-prism/Prism-prose19.pdf", "https://www.nhm.ac.uk/discover/octopuses-keep-surprising-us-here-are-eight-examples-how.html"]
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:

Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: Being an octopus presents a unique challenge in understanding what it is like to be another animal. Octopuses have a large nervous system that evolved on a different path from our own, with most of their neurons located in their arms rather than their central brain. This makes it difficult to determine whether an octopus experiences its arms as parts of itself or as parts of its environment. Understanding what it is like to be an octopus requires using memory and imagination to draw analogies with our own experiences and behaviors. The text discusses the unique experience of being an octopus, including the mixing of centrally and peripherally controlled movements and the blurring of the border between self and environment. The author also explores the concept of agency and whether non-human animals, such as octopuses, are capable of distinguishing between events they cause and those they do not. The text references experiments with chimps and monkeys that suggest some animals may have awareness of agency. Overall, the text argues that understanding the experience of being an octopus is a difficult but worthwhile endeavor.

Command get_text_summary returned:  "Result" : The article explores the subjective experience of non-human animals, specifically the octopus, and the challenges of understanding their consciousness. The unique characteristics of the octopus, such as its large nervous system and distributed organization, challenge our assumptions about animal consciousness. The article also discusses the limitations of our ability to understand the experiences of other animals and the role of memory and imagination in bridging this gap. The author considers experiments with octopuses and other animals that suggest they may have some level of awareness of their actions and environment. The article argues that studying the octopus provides valuable insights into the nature of consciousness and the limits of our understanding.

Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:

Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: Octopuses have a range of unique characteristics, including having more than one brain, being seriously clever, using tools, recognising people, having unusual reproductive methods, being self-sacrificing mothers, and having cunning disguises and escape techniques. They are also able to change color and texture to blend in with their surroundings, use ink as a defense mechanism, regenerate limbs, have three hearts, and some have been discovered to build underwater cities. Octopus blood is blue due to the presence of copper-based protein.

Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: Additional unique characteristics of octopuses include the ability to change color and texture, regenerate limbs, squirt ink as a defense mechanism, have blue blood due to the copper-based protein haemocyanin, and have three hearts. The supposedly solitary gloomy octopus was also found to build underwater cities and exhibit aggression in densely populated settlements.
